intro: Trixis aspera, commonly known as the rough trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems covered in fine, rough hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Trixis aspera is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to withstand drought conditions.
